001package imagingbook.lib.pdf;
002
003import java.awt.Font;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.util.Arrays;
006import java.util.HashSet;
007
008import com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;
009import com.lowagie.text.pdf.BaseFont;
010import com.lowagie.text.pdf.DefaultFontMapper;
011import com.lowagie.text.pdf.FontMapper;
012
013/**
014 * An implementation of {@link FontMapper} that substitutes unknown
015 * fonts with embedded core fonts (Type1).
016 * 
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public class CoreFontMapper extends DefaultFontMapper {
021        
022        public static boolean VERBOSE = false;
023        private static String classname = CoreFontMapper.class.getSimpleName();
024
025        static String[] namesMonospaced = {"DIALOG", "DIALOGINPUT", "MONOSPACED", "COURIER", "COURIER NEW"};
026        static String[] namesSerif = {"SERIF", "TIMES", "TIMESROMAN", "TIMES NEW ROMAN"};
027
028        private final HashSet<String> keysMonospaced;
029        private final HashSet<String> keysSerif;
030
031        public CoreFontMapper() {
032                keysMonospaced = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(namesMonospaced));
033                keysSerif      = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(namesSerif));
034        }
035        
036        // --------------------------------------------------
037        
038        /**
039         * Adds the logical name of a font to be treated as monospaced.
040         * All such fonts will be replaced by {@code Courier} in the PDF.
041         * @param key the logical font name
042         * @return true if insertion was successful
043         */
044        public boolean addKeyMonospaced(String key) {
045                return keysMonospaced.add(key.toUpperCase());
046        }
047        
048        /**
049         * Adds the logical name of a font to be treated as a serif font.
050         * All such fonts will be replaced by {@code Times} in the PDF.
051         * @param key the logical font name
052         * @return true if insertion was successful
053         */
054        public boolean addKeySerif(String key) {
055                return keysSerif.add(key.toUpperCase());
056        }
057
058        // --------------------------------------------------
059        
060        public BaseFont awtToPdf(Font font) {           
061                BaseFontParameters p = getBaseFontParameters(font.getFontName());
062                if (p != null) {                // font is known/registered
063                        BaseFont bf = null;
064                        try {
065                                bf = BaseFont.createFont(p.fontName, p.encoding, p.embedded, p.cached, p.ttfAfm, p.pfb);
066                        } catch (DocumentException | IOException e) {
067                                System.out.println("***** BaseFont.createFont() failed! ***");
068                        }
069                        if (VERBOSE) System.out.println(classname + ": mapped to known font " + bf.getPostscriptFontName());
070                        return bf;
071                }
072                
073                // font is not known/registered
074                String logicalName = font.getName();
075                int pos =  logicalName.indexOf('.'); // extract up to first '.'
076                if (pos >= 0) {
077                        logicalName = logicalName.substring(0, pos);    //TODO: bug in DefaultFontMapper !
078                }
079
080                boolean isIt = font.isItalic();
081                boolean isBf = font.isBold();
082
083                Type1CoreFont sf = null;
084
085                String key = logicalName.toUpperCase();
086                if (keysMonospaced.contains(key)) {
087                        if (isIt)
088                                sf = (isBf) ? Type1CoreFont.CourierBoldOblique : Type1CoreFont.CourierOblique;
089                        else
090                                sf = (isBf) ? Type1CoreFont.CourierBold : Type1CoreFont.Courier;
091                }
092                else if (keysSerif.contains(key)) {
093                        if (isIt)
094                                sf = (isBf) ? Type1CoreFont.TimesBoldItalic : Type1CoreFont.TimesItalic;
095                        else
096                                sf = (isBf) ? Type1CoreFont.TimesBold : Type1CoreFont.TimesRoman;
097                }
098                else {
099                        if (isIt)
100                                sf = (isBf) ? Type1CoreFont.HelveticaBoldOblique : Type1CoreFont.HelveticaOblique;
101                        else
102                                sf = (isBf) ? Type1CoreFont.HelveticaBold : Type1CoreFont.Helvetica;
103                }
104
105                if (VERBOSE) System.out.println(classname + ": mapped to Type1 font " + logicalName + " --> " + sf.toString());
106
107                return (sf != null) ? sf.getBaseFont() : null;
108        }
109
110        @Override
111        public Font pdfToAwt(BaseFont font, int size) {
112                return null;
113        }
114
115
116
117        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
118
119        public static void main(String[] args) {
120                FontMapper dfm = new CoreFontMapper();
121
122                //              java.awt.Font awtFont1 = new java.awt.Font(java.awt.Font.SANS_SERIF, java.awt.Font.PLAIN, 18);
123                java.awt.Font awtFont1 = new java.awt.Font(java.awt.Font.DIALOG, java.awt.Font.ITALIC, 18);
124                BaseFont bf1 = dfm.awtToPdf(awtFont1);
125                System.out.println("bf1 = " + bf1.getPostscriptFontName());
126                System.out.println("bf1.isEmbedded = " + bf1.isEmbedded());
127
128        }
129}
